DOC.brief_title: Efficacy, Safety and Tolerability of SPD485 in Children Aged 6-12 Diagnosed With ADHD
DOC.detailed_description: Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) is a psychiatric disorder characterized by 3 main symptoms: inattention, hyperactivity and impulsivity. This study will assess the efficacy, duration of effect, tolerability and safety of 4- and 6- hour wear times of SPD485 in 6-12 year old subjects diagnosed with ADHD.
DOC.criteria: Subjects have primary diagnosis of ADHD Females of childbearing potential must have a negative serum beta Human Chorionic Gonadotropin (HCG) pregnancy test Subject has an IQ score of >_ 80 Subject is able to complete as least the Basic Test of the PERMP assessment Subject has a comorbid psychiatric diagnosis such as Axis II disorders or severe Axis I disorders Subject is taking Strattera(r) Subject has a recent history of suspected substance abuse or dependence disorder
